_header: This ender night / I saw a sight / All in my sleep
Subjects: carols, lullaby; dialogues, Virgin and Christ
_description: A cradle song of the Virgin Mary — in 18-line stanzas, with 7-line burden: ‘A my dere a my dere son / Seyd Mary a my dere / [lines repeated] / Kys thy moder Jhesu / Kys thi moder Jhesu / With a lawghyng chere’

BLHar2380.First Lines:
This endres nyghtAbout mydnyghtAs I me lay for to
                    sclepe…
BLHar2380.Last Lines:
…He sayd ba baySco sayd lullayThe virgin fresch as ros in
                    m[ay]
BLHar2380.Note:
Eleven stanzas of 9 or 10 lines each, rhyming aabccb + ddd (repeated
                    each stanza as a refrain); burden lacking.
BLHar2380.Attributed Title: an old songe (in a later hand)

BLAdd5465.First Lines:
This endurs nyghtI sawe a syghtAll in my
                    slepe…
BLAdd5465.Last Lines: …Man to restoreNaylid ful soreVppon a tre
